Params: {1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory0.png'}
{3: 'Some time earlier—'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory88.png'}
{3: 'In an arctic land, a fisher, burdened by a bulging bag of tools, is trudging forward in the snow.'}
{3: 'Ahead of him is the port shared by members of the Arctic Route Union, with a couple ships lazing nearby. A group of sailors are huddled around a furnace-like heating device, chatting away.'}
{3: 'The fisher strides up to them and shouts in his signature booming voice.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Fisher', 3: "Oi, we sailin' today?", 4: '1'}
{3: "His deafening voice dusts snow off the trees and draws the sailors' attention."}
{3: 'The words evidently reach them, but the fisher is met with a "No" gesture by an annoyed-looking sailor.'}
{2: 'Fisher', 3: "Aye aye, c'mon, let's sail today!", 4: '1'}
{3: 'The fisher is aware of the gesture, but he continues on and joins in with the sailors.'}
{2: 'Sailor', 3: "Naw, won't do.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Fisher', 3: "Yer keep sayin' that over and over. How long ya havin' your vacation?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Sailor', 3: "We ain't slackin', mate. Why else d'ya thunk we're here?", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Fisher', 3: "S roight! Why EVEN are y'all here if ya ain't getting packed for sea?", 4: '1'}
{3: 'The fisher flares up at the sailors. The winds are stable, stable to the point that staying on land is blasphemy. The sea, the fishes call.'}
{2: 'Fisher', 3: "We have them Babyloony-bolognese now, just jab one of 'em serums if it gets all viral-like. C'mon, let's board!", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Sailor', 3: 'Ugh... Fer the last time, NO SAILING TODAY!', 4: '2'}
{3: 'The fisher was shaking and rattling the sailor. Unable to take it anymore, the sailor stands and tries to reason with the fisher.'}
{2: 'Sailor', 3: "I dunno why yer fishers ain't sharin' pipes with one 'nother, but we've been repeatin' it—the Corrupted in the sea...", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Fisher', 3: "Thar's always Corrupted there! And we have them big fat cannons on the ship!", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Sailor', 3: 'Just listen!', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Sailor', 3: "...The Corrupted in the sea's been hivin' it up gettin' all feisty-like. And since whatever, them stray red-eyes been bandin' all together in one place.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Fisher', 3: "Stray reddies...? Even those from the no-man's zones?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Sailor', 3: "Yarr, for sum reason they all dived somewhere. Dunno where they be headed, but they're relayin' it through the sea 'ere.", 4: '2'}
{3: 'Hearing the sailor, the fisher begins to realize the gravity of the situation. He pulls at the tools tilting from his back and slings them astern.'}
{2: 'Fisher', 3: "Uh... We gon' be safe here?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Sailor', 3: "Least for now they're not tryna' land. Simply shoalin' it up here 'fore going somewhere else.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Fisher', 3: "So them Corrupted's getting fewer around here, aye? When they're done swarmin' it all up in the seas, then we should be safe to go?", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Interrupting the conversation is a spear-wielding centauress, followed by a group of her kind. Just like the fisher, they are bearing bags.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Fisher', 3: "Oh, Forest Guards... There ain't any of them Corruptoes here, eh?", 4: '2'}
{3: 'Astonished by the presence of the humanoid hybrid Constructs, the fisher asks inquisitively, curious as to why they are here.'}
{2: 'Diana', 3: "The Corrupted are all in the sea. We're here for something else.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Diana', 3: "We don't know when the Corrupted will be back. But this much we know—nothing good will come out of it if they gather up.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Diana', 3: 'So can we borrow your ships, sailors?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Sailor', 3: "You tailin' em red-eyes?", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Diana', 3: "Yes, to find out what they're up to. I... have a bad feeling about this.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Sailor', 3: '...Whadda we do, Capt?', 4: '2'}
{3: 'The sailor turns to ask the man who has stayed silent all this time. The man ponders, his eyes darting between his ships and the Forest Guards.'}
{2: 'Captain', 3: 'I can lend you the ships, but on one condition.', 4: '1'}
{3: "Diana furrows her eyebrows at the captain's response. She falters a little, but she quickly hides her expression."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Diana', 3: "We don't have much to offer in exchange. If it can go cheaper...", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Captain', 3: 'Not for this, no.', 4: '2'}
{3: "The captain loudly interrupts Diana in a sullen voice. An embarrassed look crosses Diana's face."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Diana', 3: "...Because we're sinners?", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Captain', 3: "Pah, you think I still care about that? You can have the ship, sink it, whatever. But all of you must come back 'ere in one piece—that's my condition.", 4: '1'}
{3: "Diana's consternation quickly gives way to joy. She holds the captain's big stretched-out hand."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Diana', 3: 'Thank you. We promise to hold up our end of the bargain.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Captain', 3: 'Alright then. Boys! Give them the keys. And get your stinky laundry off the ships!', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Sailor', 3: 'Wait, Captain, are we not going with them?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Captain', 3: "We can't fight. We'll only hold them back if we go, that I'm sure of. Alright then, move it!", 4: '1'}
{3: "Following the captain's command, the sailors swing to action. Even the fisher, still in a daze, joins the effort. The Forest Guards murmur between themselves."}
{2: 'Forest Guard', 3: "Didn't know their attitude toward us had changed so much..."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Diana', 3: 'Which is all the more reason for us to find out what the Corrupted are up to.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Diana', 3: 'Not only to protect ourselves, but also to protect this place.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Diana', 3: "We'll board the ships as soon as they're ready. Forest Guards, prepare to set sail!", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Forest Guard', 3: 'Understood!'}
{2: 'Diana', 3: "...Rosetta, I know you'd do the same thing.", 4: '1'}
